intro: Mirabilis latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf four-o'clock, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the late afternoon and close at dawn. The plant has broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of vibrant pink or red blooms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Mirabilis latifolia is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
